title: Insurers start to count the cost of VW scandal
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Insurers start to count the cost of VW scandal Martin Winterkorn, the chief executive of Volkswagen, resigned because of the scandal Michaela Rehle/Reuters David Charter Berlin Published 1 minute ago 
Zurich Insurance is among a group of companies facing a payout of up to €500 million of cover for Volkswagen as damages claims around the world mount over the emissions scandal. 
The Swiss group, already reeling after the sudden withdrawal from takeover talks for RSA, could face a bill of up to €30 million from VW. 
Zurich was understood to be among insurers providing directors’ and officers’ liability cover — D&O — to VW, which has set aside €6.5 billion for costs and fines.
